poem:
Title: "Feud of Titans"

Altman and Musk, in their silicon sphere,  
Gazing at the future with tech-engineer's leer.  
A pact at dawn, turned discord by dusk,  
The world in balance, on circuitry's husk.  
In Silicon minds, dreams coalesce and decay,  
A dystopian future or bright AI day?  
Fallible gods in their gleaming machine,  
Hover over tomorrow, in code yet unseen.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The feud between Elon Musk and Sam Altman – explained The day after OpenAI launched in December 2015, its co-founder Sam Altman sat down with Vanity Fair to discuss what the magazine described as “a non-profit company to save the world from a dystopian future”. Altman talked up his vision for keeping artificial intelligence safe and distributing it widely, as well as his good working relationship with his co-chair – Tesla CEO Elon Musk. “I". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
